abstracts.cdata!:
This Project Paper seeks the approval of
            the Executive Directors to provide Additional Financing for
            Phase II of the Education Investment Program (ESIP II or the
            Project), presently financed under IDA Credit 4222-MLI. The
            additional financing is required to complete the original
            project activities in view of a new financing gap that has
            emerged over the past year related to expected parallel
            financing for primary education. The original project
            development objective remains the same: to increase the
            proportion of Malian children completing a quality first
            cycle of basic education and improve the overall efficiency
            of resources used in the education sector. No changes to the
            components, key performance indicators, or implementation
            modalities of the project are being proposed. A one year
            extension of the closing date is proposed to allow for a
            full implementation of the project activities. The
            Project's original objective, design and scope remain unchanged.
